page.title: 01Barassie Snads & Hinterland
page.content: The seaward area comprises 2 golf courses and some housing. Part of the northern landward area is being filled in. The higher southern area mainly comprises 2 quarries, Hillhouse and Hallyards. One the edge of this area is another houseing development. A railway line runs across the moss, used mainly for freight and the quarry. The A78 trunk road has recently been re-aligned to make a by-pass. For employment there is a pharmaceutical plant outside the square or people commute to Ayr, Kilmarnock, Irvine or Glasgow. Above the quarry is a MOD installation. In square 6, a former army camp is now a residential area. Square 8 has the ruins of the 17th century Auchans House. Another rail- way line, the passenger service to Glasgow, runs NS and is being electrif
